headlines: Here’s what happened in crypto today
Crypto losses near $3.4B as hackers went ‘big game hunting’
Federal Reserve Board withdraws 2023 policy statement and issues new policy statement regarding the treatment of certain Board-supervised banks that facilitates responsible innovation
Federal Reserve Board announces termination of enforcement actions with The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc. and Metropolitan Commercial Bank
Agencies announce dollar thresholds for smaller loan exemption from appraisal requirements for higher-priced mortgage loans
events: Record $2 billion crypto theft by North Korean hackers highlights security risks but also market size and activity
RWA (Real-World Assets) compliance discussion by former SEC counsel
Bitcoin-gold ratio hit a multi-year low, indicating strong relative performance of BTC
Security breach: Multisig wallet compromised and drained of up to $40M
Regulatory movement: CFTC official joining crypto firm MoonPay, signaling regulatory engagement
Corporate partnership: Bitcoin miner Hut 8 partnering with Google-backed entity
CPI inflation data came in at 2.7%, slightly below expectations and supporting dovish Fed sentiment
Regulatory development: US Fed updates guidance on bank involvement with crypto
Institutional adoption: DTCC issuing tokenized securities on a blockchain network (Canton)
